result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reuben Ray Salaz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reuben Ray Salaz not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Reuben Ray Salaz.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for  Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Arraignment.
Defendant not produced from MSDF.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reuben Ray Salaz not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Reuben Ray Salaz.  
Attorney William Ackell for  Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Arraignment.
Defendant not produced from MSDF.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Arraignment scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reuben Ray Salaz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont on behalf of Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Reuben Ray Salaz.  Prosecuting Attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective L. Belli. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Arial Rosenberg, received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Victim ED-M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reuben Ray Salaz appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Reuben Ray Salaz. Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4) 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
